summary_gpt: Apollo Tyres Ltd. announced a change in its senior management structure, with Mr. C. Krishna Kumar shifting reporting lines to align with global manufacturing, effective May 1, 2025, and will no longer be part of the senior management team.

Apollo Tyres Ltd. has disclosed that it did not undertake any borrowing through debt securities for FY 2024-25, and there are no penalties or shortfalls reported. The company remains compliant with its borrowing obligations for the specified period.

The filing discloses Apollo Tyres Ltd.'s outstanding borrowings as of March 31, 2025, amounting to Rs. 2,452.72 crore, along with their credit ratings and compliance details. It is a regulatory disclosure related to the company's financial obligations and credit ratings for the fiscal year.

Apollo Tyres Ltd. has acquired an additional 3.43% stake in Green Infra Wind Power Projects Limited, increasing its total shareholding to 21.27%. The acquisition aims to procure wind power and is expected to be completed by the first week of May 2025.

Apollo Tyres has submitted a Restated Trust Deed for its Employees Stock Option Scheme 2025, in compliance with SEBI regulations. This indicates ongoing employee benefit programs and corporate governance updates.

Apollo Tyres plans to discontinue tyre production at its Netherlands subsidiary's Enschede plant by summer 2026 due to high production costs, subject to local consultation and approval. The closure will impact approximately 5.8% of the company's revenue and 8.4% of its net worth as of March 2024.
